ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course really helped me have a deeper understanding of the art history discipline. Having it once a week was helpful because it gave me more time to do the readings and grapple with the questions that arose from them.
Different approaches to the art historical field. How to interpret mainly philosophical and art historical texts.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Too much reading resulted in skimming the texts and not absorbing or addressing in class as much as I would have liked. The material was great but perhaps a little over-intellectualized
Something that could improve is perhaps more time with the professor explaining the basic terms and ideas of the week before the student presentations begin.

I enjoyed the presentation format of the course. It Presenting on a certain method solidified understanding of that method. However, more contribution from Professor Ng would have been nice as much of the material was extremely difficult to understand, as it was chiefly philosophical.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It is a challenging course, but very rewarding. Especially for art history majors, this will really build your foundations and teach you ways to think about art and art history that you can apply to all your other courses. The readings were heavy and required a lot of concentration, but the in-class discussions/presentations were very clarifying. The process of building your understanding as a group, through the student-led presentations, was useful.
Yes- foundational for the art history major.
